DESC.PARA: An emission spectrum from hot diffuse gas based on the model calculations of Raymond and Smith (ApJSuppl 35, 419 and additions) including line emission from several elements. This model interpolates on a grid of spectra for different temperatures. The grid is logarithmically spaced with 80 temperatures ranging from 0.008 to 80 keV.
This is an additive model component.

ROW.DATA: metal abundances (He fixed at cosmic) The elements included are C, N, O, Ne, Mg, Si, S, Ar, Ca, Fe, Ni and their relative abundances are set by the set_xsabund command.
10^-14 / (4 pi (D_A*(1+z))^2) Int n_e n_H dV, where D_A is the angular size distance to the source (cm), n_e is the electron density (cm^-3), and n_H is the hydrogen density (cm^-3)

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.7.1 of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.4.1.
